meanings.definition: A structure made of piles driven into the ground to provide support for a building or other structure.
meanings.sent1: The tall pilings held up the bridge securely.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers placed the pilings deep into the ground.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the pilings as a jungle gym.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as the pilings supporting the skyscraper.
meanings.sent5: The pilings stood like soldiers, unwavering in their duty to support the building.

meanings.definition: The act of driving piles into the ground to create a foundation.
meanings.sent1: The noisy machine echoed through the neighborhood as it worked on the pilings.
meanings.sent2: The crew completed the pilings before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The rhythmic sound of the pilings being driven into the ground was oddly soothing.
meanings.sent4: Their teamwork was the strong foundation, just like the pilings they were working on.
meanings.sent5: The pilings marked the beginning of a new chapter in the town's history.

meanings.definition: A row of piles used as a support for a dock or pier.
meanings.sent1: The boats docked safely next to the sturdy pilings.
meanings.sent2: The salty sea air surrounded the pilings on the pier.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls perched on the pilings, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: The pilings stood strong against the crashing waves, like guardians of the sea.
meanings.sent5: The pilings creaked softly as the boats gently bumped against them.
